website_summaries.verdict: The Audio Technica ATH-ANC9 QuietPoint headphones deliver quality audio in passive and active modes, but noise-cancellation performance is not in line with the price.
pros: Deep bass response, with no distortion at top volumes
Removable cablesâ€”one with inline microphone and remote
cons: Noise cancellation mics sometimes allow low transient sounds into in-ear mix
Doesn't ship with a rechargeable battery

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones. The sound quality is amazing, the feel and comfort i think is great, the look is cool and the noise cancelling really does work very well. The only reason i'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is because the white noise hissing sound you get when you turn on the noise cancelling is noticeable enough, it doesn't interefere with the music once you click play, but you don't really get a quiet bubble with the NC on. For $200 i kind of expected no white noise but i really don't mind that much about it.
customer_reviews.author: Guillermo

customer_reviews.title: Good product however both ear cushions are damaged after less ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product however both ear cushions are damaged after less than 10 long haul flights .... obviously low quality and not properly tested by the product team
customer_reviews.author: bruno gillot

customer_reviews.title: I have a 7 3/4+ head, at full extension they fit well.
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing to dislike imo. Mine were NIB. The noise cancelling switch is a slider not a push button and at first it was kinda hung up on a burr, a few on & offs and all is well. These were originally $380 retail so the price here is about a third that... a good deal. These are rather plane-jane looking and make them less attractive to unwanted attention a plus in my world. I've only used them for about 12 hours, find the dynamic range excellent as I listen to classical music that demands dynamic range. The bass listening to UB40 is never muddy. Carrying case is good. Enjoy the ride!
customer_reviews.author: John J.

customer_reviews.title: After only 4 months of use, just at the ...
customer_reviews.text: After only 4 months of use, just at the office, the lining around the ear pieces broke and so the noise canceling effect has been affected. Given that I always put them in the case and that they are new, this should not have happened.
customer_reviews.author: Nan Roman

customer_reviews.title: Noise-canceling function stopped working after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I loved these headphones when I first got them, although I hate that they take AA batteries instead of just having a rechargeable battery. The worst and saddest part is that these STOPPED WORKING after just 3 months of use! If I try to turn the noise-canceling function on, I can't get any audio at all and there's no beep showing that the noise canceling is even working. So now they're just very pricy, wired, over-the-head head phones. Pretty sad that I wasted a hundred bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Wasatch928

customer_reviews.title: Large, Good Build Quality, Good Sound, Good Noise Cancelling
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to replace my old JVC HANC250 noise-cancelling headphones, which fell apart after a few years of use. The Audio Technicas are much better than the JVCs - The build quality is better, the sound is better, and the noise cancelling is *much* better. While these headphones will not cancel 100% of ambient noise, they do a great job. In fact, I would not want them to cancel all ambient noise for safety and courtesy reasons. They have great battery life. I'm still using the included battery after hours and hours of play. The build quality seems to be good as well. The only drawback is that they are large, and the carrying case is large.
customer_reviews.author: ET

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY. Ear pads falling apart. Warranty info on page incorrect
customer_reviews.text: The foam is spilling out of the ear pads and is about to render my headphones unusable. The warranty information on this product page links to a TWO year warranty, but AT's website says it's only a ONE year warranty. So now my $200 headphones are falling apart, having only lasted just over one year of occasional use, and dying right after the warranty is up. What a waste of money. I've contacted both AT, who won't honor Amazon's erroneously listed warranty, and Amazon, who refuse to even credit me the cost I would pay AT to repair the headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Shidarin

customer_reviews.title: Unbalanced Audio/Only Plays Out Right Ear
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my wife for her birthday in April (naturally, meaning we have missed the return window). Initially, the audio only came through on the right side. After firmly pushing the plug into the headset, audio did come through the left side, but very quietly. Noise canceling only works on the right side, left side does nothing. I read a bunch of great reviews, and my wife was very excited to use these on our upcoming vacation, unfortunately she is very disappointed and upset.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: I have an older model of these at home and bought this one for work. I work in an office that moved to one of those noisy, sometimes crazy, open floor plans... these really help cancel out noise and the sound is great. They came with a nice case too so I can safey store them in my paked locker.
customer_reviews.author: kathy k

customer_reviews.title: They stick way out from your head and the carrying case is pretty large. With that said
customer_reviews.text: So I should preface that I'm a big AT fan and have had the ANC7 for many years (still running strong) but was looking for an upgrade. I travel frequently and was excited to go with the bigger brother of the ANC7. What I didn't expect when I got them was literally how big they are. They stick way out from your head and the carrying case is pretty large. With that said....the sound is amazing and is on par if not better than the Bose QP25. For me the size was a deal breaker and I returned them for the sleeker/smaller QP25. If you're ok with the larger bulky nature of them, they are a solid product.
customer_reviews.author: PFloyd

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Noise Cancelling Headphones
customer_reviews.text: All I can really say about these Audio Technica headphones is WOW! Wore them for my entire plane flight from DFW to Madrid, Spain (9 hours) and almost the entire time it seemed as if I was in a quiet library. Watched some movies and the sound was fantastic! Music was crisp, clear, and plenty of bass. Now, I'm no audiophile, but I've not heard as good sound even from my Bose earbuds. And the single AAA battery lasted me the flight to Spain AND back, and all the time I was in Europe on a bus tour! Buy them!
customer_reviews.author: Jose L Herrera II

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for the quality you get for the price
customer_reviews.text: For someone who enjoys more bass in their headphone's quality, these did the trick for the price and for the type of headphones they are (these are noise cancellation, not one's strictly focused on pure quality). For the price, they definitely delivered the quality of sound and noise cancellation I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cans for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Overall I was very impressed with these headphones. The sound quality and noise cancelling both were very good - I liked these better than Bose 25's, however the design and build quality were less than expected. The plastic pivot points seem to be poorly designed and a big risk for shorted cables or broken hinges. But I suppose that's to be expected for mid-price range headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Packers fan in Hoosierland

customer_reviews.title: Ear pads keep splitting, cables are fragile
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if it's because my son wears these SO much but the ear pads have needed to be replaced 8 times. We have other audio-technical headphones that are older that never had this problem. The cords have been replaced a few times as well. It came with a one year warranty so this has been inconvenient but free to get replacement parts and the company is helpful. My son still loves these so I think I will have to buy him a new pair as it wouldn't be cost effective to keep replacing pads and cables.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Bean

customer_reviews.title: If you need an affordable set that does the job, these are the one.
customer_reviews.text: So these headphones were great, but eventually the casing for the headphones started to detach and so I had to stop using it. After, though, I received an old pair of Bose headphones and I felt like I was missing out on so much with these headphones. The Bose headphones were so comfortable! However, they're 3 years old and when I tested the new Bose headphones, they didn't feel as comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely happy with these headphones. I bought them during Black Friday for $149 and am glad I did. The noise canceling works great on my flights overseas. My ear don't get bothered by them at all during an 8hr flight. The only down side Ive found is the headphone cables are extremely thin and flimsy and will surely not last. I can't believe AT sent these out like that. I will be finding a replacement asap and already have my eye on one that includes a built in mic.
customer_reviews.author: Alex B.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but broken.
customer_reviews.text: It's comfortable - which is really saying something since I'm very picky. However, the noise canceling function gradually stopped working (or maybe it never worked properly to begin with). Since the warranty (1 year limited) expired, seems they won't even consider fixing / replacing it. I wish I'd gone with Bose.
customer_reviews.author: Terminal Student

customer_reviews.title: Should have lasted longer.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased mine from Amazon in early 2015 and have traveled with them since. It seemed like the ANC was starting to get worse the last few trips and sure enough, the right driver failed last night on a flight and both ear pad covers have split. For the money, the performance was very good but should have lasted a little more than 4 years given that I don't use them more than a dozen times a year. Also, they do fold, but the hard case is quite large.
customer_reviews.author: AJG

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones for the price
customer_reviews.text: Headphones are really nice. For the price they sound great. Good highs and lows. The battery life has been really good so far. The noise cancelling is pretty good. Compared to Bose they block out most noise but aren't as good. If you don't have any audio playing you can hear a buzzing noise. It doesn't affect the audio so I don't mind but it's important to note. The build seems nice. And the carrying case is pretty high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price range
customer_reviews.text: I bought these back in 2018 for when the price was closer to $100 and thought they were a good value for the money. I would be very tempted to go with the Bose Quiet comfort 35 II now that these are over $200. The ear cushions split after about one and a half years and I had to get replacements.
customer_reviews.author: Sleepy Mike

customer_reviews.title: The most comfortable headphones I have used
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is not as long as I expected but it is no big you just need to keep a couple spares with you. The comfort is amazing I have never used more comfortable headphones. Sound quality is amazing, it is very balanced and works with music types. The noise cancelling is very good, it has made my bus rides much more pleasant. All in all a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expected better construction
customer_reviews.text: I'm no audiophile, but headphone audio is good and the noise cancelling works pretty well. All of that doesn't really matter when they start to fall apart. Attached is a picture of the headphone cups after 2 years. Keep in mind this is after I contacted Audio Technica and got replacements. I reached out to them again to get replacement pads for the replacement pads, but they now cost $15 I believe. At the rate that these split open it isn't worth contacting them for replacements every 6 months. If it weren't for the ear cups they would be 5 stars. I expected more for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Kingsley

customer_reviews.title: Too big and bulky to carry
customer_reviews.text: Purchased and returned. They are gigantic headphones, so if you are planning on carrying them in a laptop bag, forget about it. You'll need a large bag if you want to carry these with you on a plane. Comfort wise they were nice and noise cancellation seemed decent, but not on par with Bose headphones. I returned these and purchased the QC25s, which although are much more expensive, are also much more portable and the best noise cancellation I have experienced.
customer_reviews.author: adg44

customer_reviews.title: A good travel partner
customer_reviews.text: The headset cups are soft and comfortable, but the overall tightness of the headset tires your head, ears and neck on long airline flights. I've found these are great for 2-3 hour flights, so I use them on my more-numerous short flights.
customer_reviews.author: KARL LEWIS

customer_reviews.title: 4 years later: Earpads split open, but otherwise fine!
customer_reviews.text: Update: I've now had and used these headphones for 4 years and they're still going strong. 1. The ear pads _do_ split open relatively fast. The first time that happened it was 9 months in and it was covered under warranty. 2. The replacement ear pads from audio technical's also split open. 3. I recently bought these after market ear pads, and they're actually more comfy. They're also cheap enough that I'm not concerned about ear pads splitting in the future:
customer_reviews.author: ibash

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after about a year
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in February of 2018. The performance was acceptable ... about what you'd expect for the price point. However, they just suddenly stopped working in May of 2019 (despite only occasional use over the course of that year ... perhaps an average of once a month, just for airplane trips). I tried multiple fresh batteries, which I had verified with a battery tester, yet the power light on the headphone never comes on, and I get no audio when I try using the headphones. Unacceptable quality.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Meretzky

customer_reviews.title: Best ANC headphones I have found
customer_reviews.text: I love these ANC headphones. I am not sure if the different filter modes offer any real additional value, but in general I find that these perform better on airplanes than the Bose, and they are a relative bargain. I purchased an earlier version something like 10 years ago and they still work great, but the surface of the earcups finally started to wear off, so I decided to get a new pair. Have purchased 4 more pairs for friends and family. High quality and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Herbert Longfellow

customer_reviews.title: Very average noise cancelation
customer_reviews.text: The overall sound quality is really good and I personally prefer the slightly bass heavy sound quality (when it's powered by a charged aaa battery). Sound quality in the absence of a battery to power the internal amp, is mediocre. Having to use an external battery for good music is quiet irritating at times. The 3 modes of noise cancelation are subpar and do not provide a good listening experience. Electronic hiss noise is very prominent and sometimes irritating when listening to music at low volumes. For 50 bucks more I got the Sony h.ear Bluetooth headphones which have a way better noise cancellation and doesn't require an external battery to power the noise cancelation and amp.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sound: Excellent | Noise Isolation: Very Good | Ear Pad Durability: Very Poor
customer_reviews.text: I will have to git it 3 stars, the foam on the headphone within a few months of light usage already needs replacement. :( It still sounds great and the noise isolation is almost spot on with more expensive alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Cypriano

customer_reviews.title: Most Used Purchased
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I was NOT expecting it to sound that good and the noise canceling function is great even when it's not on. I broke the battery holder thing and it's difficult to take out but it functions okay without batteries just less noise cancelling
customer_reviews.author: Kane Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Music sounded awful
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to listen to music (not to block out sound). For some strange reason, vocals of high pitched singers were inaudible. The guitar, bass and drums sounded ok (not great). It was quite strange. If someone knows a good brand of headphones to listen to music please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: Anne R.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these. I use them 6-8 hrs/day at work with glasses and no discomfort. Sound is AMAZING. Replaced a high end pair of Klipsch headphones with these and I cannot believe the improved audio fidelity! Noise cancellation modes work very well for different situations. Most importantly, they work without a battery (not noise cancellation obviously) and cord can be replaced with most any SLIM 3.5mm phono cable
customer_reviews.author: BAM

customer_reviews.title: perfect for flying and cost effective
customer_reviews.text: an upgrade from my lower model Audio Technica ANC7B headset. ANC9 is a better fit, slightly larger. three noise cancellation settings. adjusted the settings on two flights, two different airplanes generated different background noise. a simple push of the button found the best setting for each plane. just be careful as the plastic may break when you expand them to put over your head. less expensive than Bose, and Bose does not publish the specifications on their headphones. Beats is well crafted and appears to be made from aircraft quality aluminum, but I found Beats too large to carry in my bag, and too expensive.
customer_reviews.author: NiceTallGuy

customer_reviews.title: Reduces lawnmower noise nicely
customer_reviews.text: Bought these headphones to reduce the noise from the large zero turn lawn mower. They perform that task admirably on the blue setting. it is much more comfortable when on the machine for hours, and being able to change the battery as needed is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: MN Pat

customer_reviews.title: Love these headphones!  They work great!  Sound is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Headphones work great! Sound is crystal clear! I can't hear a thing except my music! I love it! You can use them just as stereo headphones, or noise-cancelling headphones for Airplane, Office, or Study mode. For noise-cancelling to work though, you do need a AAA battery in the headphones. But it's worth it! I almost want to listen to all my music on these headphones! You can really enjoy the music on another level with these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Moon

customer_reviews.title: These bad boys have saved my sanity at work
customer_reviews.text: These bad boys have saved my sanity at work. As a writer surrounded by marketing coordinators constantly talking to their managers, members or each other I couldn't concentrate until I got these. I love the three settings, sound quality, and comfort of these headphones. There's nothing more satisfying than turning on the noise-canceling feature and hearing nothing but my music.
customer_reviews.author: Kris W

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: I have probably 10 pairs of headphones, and these compare with the best of them. At this price, they can't be beat. Not only do I use them to listen to music, but I also use them when practicing with my guitar, and the sound quality is very good!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Tylee

customer_reviews.title: I gave this ones a try and they are awesome, all the low frequency noise is gone
customer_reviews.text: I work repairing servers and I was getting tired of the fan noise all day. I gave this ones a try and they are awesome, all the low frequency noise is gone. I do not have to crank the volume all the way up like with my other headphones. They are very comfortable to wear. They seem solid and well build. They have nice base and treble clarity. They also cancel the noise without any cable or player connected. Like the 3 way cancelling noise button. Very happy with my them.
customer_reviews.author: Osvaldo Luis

customer_reviews.title: Good Noise Cancelling Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Bought two pair of these for travelling. I am amazed by the noise cancelling ability of these headphones! Put them on after take off, then turn on the noise cancelling mode and listen to the difference! Good sound quality also when listening to music or movies. Great for flying.
customer_reviews.author: Colo Stego

customer_reviews.title: Don’t function like normal headphones
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned a pair of ANC7 for about 9 years and they’re great. They were wearing out so I decided to buy these but for some reason I have to turn the volume up really high to be able to hear sounds that should be there at a normal range. I never had to raise the volume on the AVC7. I would trade these for a new pair of ANC7 if they were available. These burn batteries so fast It’ll make your head spin. Don’t buy these. I’m going to throw mine away and learn from my mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best compromise I've found for price, great sound AND noise reduction
customer_reviews.text: I tried Bose, I tried Sennheiser, and I ended up going with these Audio Technicas... And I fly ALL the time (2-4 cities a week, so 3-8 flights a week). Bose - Great noise reduction. Audio quality was so-so. Price was absurd. Sennheiser - Audio quality was great. Noise reduction was a joke. Audio Technica - Noise reduction is really good... Not QUITE Bose, but very good and WAY better than Sennheiser... Audio Quality was also very good... not quite Sennheiser, but close, and much better than Bose. For the price, Audio Technica's ATH ANC9 headphones are a GREAT value, sound excellent, and really do a great job with the noise cancelling.
customer_reviews.author: The DenTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: you CANNOT go wrong!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to go on a trip to France. I cannot believe how amazing they worked! 9 hour flight there and 9 hours back, I kept these on the whole time - except for me playing around just to see how much noise these things blocked out. They're amazing! And they're super Comfortable! I find myself wearing them around the house to block out much of my kids' general noise - they work great! I was worried after reading a few reviews about guys with big heads and these didn't fit ... first of all, I believe those guys had SUPER big heads; because, my head is big, and these fit great.
customer_reviews.author: KerryWhite

customer_reviews.title: Defective right ear.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought two pairs of these from two different sellers (the second one from Amazon, first from elsewhere). In both cases, the right ear started to produce buzzing sounds and a wildly uneven sound profile--the first pair within the first two days, and this pair after a couple months. Though when the headphones work, they are excellent, the level of shoddy craftsmanship here is impossible to overlook or overstate. These are very poorly made and I cannot recommend them, for anyone in any use case.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Yule

customer_reviews.title: Excellent NC and Sound
customer_reviews.text: I returned Bose QC15 for these. BOTH sounds quality AND noise canceling are superior, they are solid and comfortable... and cheaper. Initially, I was skeptical when Gizmodo ranked them 1st (Bose QC15 4th) but when I got them I agreed.
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed Zen

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't ask for a better experience
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with these cans. The noise canceling is good, but the sound fidelity and quality of these are superb. The build quality is decent and my only complaint is that the ear pads seem jagged about the edges and aren't consistent on both sides. I asked Audiotechnica about this and they explained that was the intended design and then sent me an extra set of ear pads to quell my concerns. Overall the sound performance of this model and the customer service given to me by ATh was so great that I couldn't ask for a better experience. I would recommend this product to anyone thinking about buying, or are on fence between these and Bose QCs.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Wildonger

customer_reviews.title: Great noise-cancelling headphones
customer_reviews.text: I really like these headphones for both recording music and just listening. I've used them while travelling on airplanes and while recording drums and the noise-cancelling really works well. Compared to other noise-cancelling headphones I've used, these work the best. The volume is lacking when plugged into my phone but the quality of the sound is still pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Leyden

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Tried Bose noise canceling headphones before (from a friend or at Best Buy), but never pulled the trigger because of the price tag was a little steep for me. I'm no audiophile, but I listen to music and audiobooks at a desk all day (software developer). I can't really distinguish much between these and Bose noise canceling headphones.
customer_reviews.author: lbarker

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancellation fail !
customer_reviews.text: The product is built and finished well but functionality can be a lot better. Noise cancellation is absolutely below average. Not sure why the music cuts off when switching modes and why music needs to be muted for the "beep". Stay with Bose or B&O if you are already a customer. If you looking for budget phones - I personally recommend the Nakamichi which gives excellent ANC for that price. This particular mode simply doesn't cut ...
customer_reviews.author: Karthik

customer_reviews.title: exceptional value
customer_reviews.text: Bose schmose, these sound better and have technology you can train to your ear. I bought these on a recommendation from a friend of mine. He is a band and has a better ear than mine and knows music. The ear cups feel really comfortable on your year, comfortable enough to wear them on a 5 1/2 hour cross country flight and never notice them on. They have 3 levels of noise cancellation capability and set it to max and you will sleep like a baby. AT knows what they are doing when it comes to NC technology. I liked these so much I bought 2 other pairs as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: T Rex

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! I have recently used the headphone during the ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I have recently used the headphone during the flight and hav never experienced better noise cancellation with any other headphone. Absolutely recommending. The only point i am curious is if the quality can be as good as this one through Bluetooth connection instead of wired with gold covered jacks?
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Great while they lasted...
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these until the leather split on the ears, now the foam is coming out. I've owned these for 1.5 years, which isn't that long for a 200 dollar set of headphones, even less when considering I use them on a monthly basis, I've only had to change the battery a handful of times. Really disappointing build quality. The previous Seinhesser and Sony over ear headphones lasted multiple years before the earpiece leather split. Would not recommend or buy again, in the market for a better build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Tim F

customer_reviews.title: Good for commuting, not for office environment
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable. Decent sound quality. They attenuate road noise in public transportation reasonably well. They're basically useless in an office environment if you're near the kitchen. When the ambient noise is low, all you hear is a hiss that's louder than the outside noise.
customer_reviews.author: Cat People

customer_reviews.title: Shoddy workmanship
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two of these. The headphones were not worn very much. However, the vinyl over the ear padding split on both headphones within the first year as shown in the attached image. Pretty shoddy workmanship if they can't even last a year with light usage. I would not recommend these for the price paid.
customer_reviews.author: S. Weir

customer_reviews.title: Good for noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: The greatest endorsement I can give for these headphones is that their noise cancelling feature has allowed me to block out all foreign noises from the subway and allows for a painless subway ride. I agree with other reviewers who said that these headphones are not the best for audiophiles and they perform better with the noise cancelling turned on. I also had a hard time opening the battery compartment for the headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia

customer_reviews.title: After a year the padding started coming out of the ...
customer_reviews.text: After a year the padding started coming out of the leather encasing... This are my third noise cancelling headphones. I probably would not buy them again. I'll go back to Bose
customer_reviews.author: LOPEZ RUIZ HECTOR

customer_reviews.title: After 14 months of use both earpads have split and ...
customer_reviews.text: After 14 months of use both earpads have split and the foam is coming out. Asked AT customer support and was told to contact the parts dept for replacement parts. Have had lesser AT models but this is the first.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Hunt

customer_reviews.title: but I am happy with my purchase and decision on these
customer_reviews.text: These do the trick for noise canceling at my office. They do not block out 100%, but I am happy with my purchase and decision on these. Very comfortable if you don't wear glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: I use it for international flights. the ANC works extremely well. The disadvantage is: my ears overheat, other wise, it double as earmuffs in cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Goods

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headphones
customer_reviews.text: I use these at work, on planes and trains, the Doctor's offices etc. Excellent sound, the pesky outside noises disappear. Extremely useful.
customer_reviews.author: jv

customer_reviews.title: High quality audio but not structurally sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Good audio, but barely fits my son's noggin. Needs to be bigger. I now lowered my rating nine months after first use. A plastic clip, my finger is pointing at it on the attached photo, a plastic cover on one ear pad is splitting and the wire is shorting out. The electronics and speaker may provide quality audio, but mechanically won't stand up to daily use for more than 8-9 months.
customer_reviews.author: MB resident

customer_reviews.title: Poor Craftsmanship and bulky container
customer_reviews.text: After using these headphones three times the right ear piece separated from the headphone because of poor craftsmanship. The size of the container for the headphones is large and bulky, the batteries last a very short time. To repair the poorly made headphone the company's repair department wanted almost the cost of a new set. do not understand how this terrible product gets such affirmations.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: My wife got to listen to her first Cubs game with them Sunday afternoon and loved them. We have several trips planned over the ...
customer_reviews.text: These were a Mothers Day gift for a huge baseball fan. My wife got to listen to her first Cubs game with them Sunday afternoon and loved them. We have several trips planned over the next couple of months and she is looking forward to the Noice Cancelling feature, especially on our flying trips.
customer_reviews.author: Javadavy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: These seemed good. But the I noticed that the lyrics in my songs have changed when I had the noise cancelling on.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones.  Excellent buy.
customer_reviews.text: These are great headphones. I'm a headphone snob. I use Focal Spirit Pro's and the ATH M50's in my studio. These are close and even better with noise cancellation, especially on a plane.
customer_reviews.author: cbusser

customer_reviews.title: I bought it for my son. He says it ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my son. He says it helps with the noise (lawnmowers and tractors) but not to the extent I expected from the advertisements and based on the price. Update: He has used it for about 4 months now and it has quit working.
customer_reviews.author: grandma

customer_reviews.title: the noise cancelling is really good, but the sound is lacking in power
customer_reviews.text: cuffs broke off after a while. I use duct tape to hold them together, still worth listening to but have seriously deteriorated. not as durable as I hoped (I am very reckless with my stuff so this is very important to me. also I use them excessively). I wish I'd gotten the M50s instead but can't complain. the noise cancelling is really good, but the sound is lacking in power, but very good anyways. 7/10
customer_reviews.author: tym

customer_reviews.title: They sound quality is very good and the noise cancelling is very good
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair. One for me, one for each of two sons purchased one at a time over the last 3 years. They sound quality is very good and the noise cancelling is very good. They have held up very well. I especially liked the airplane mode where it cuts out the engine noise but lets human voices come through.
customer_reviews.author: BDeck

customer_reviews.title: Superb sound quality and price. Can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones! Worth the price. No gimmicks like those designer brands. Straight forward, great sound, great range, great noise cancellation. Very happy with this purchase. Looked up some reviews comparing similar models and price points. These are the best. I've owned Beats, Sony, Skullcandy, and Senheiser and these blow everything out of the water.
customer_reviews.author: Aesthetic Al

customer_reviews.title: Did Not last
customer_reviews.text: I loved these when i got them about 3 years ago. 1 year foam pad didnt last, i figured no biggie, then battery insert stop reading any battery at all removing the noise isolation feature, then the headphones began having uneven sound between the 2 ear pads....i was listening to the same music just fine couple days ago...these didnt end well for me...Move On DUE not BUY
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: This device surpassed my expectation in virtually all ways. The sound is very good, very true and without excessive bass or other modifications. Build quality is good, the plastic doesn't squeak or grind. They are relatively light weight. The noise cancelling does have some hiss sound, but for this price the amount it blocks is quite good.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Hirsh

customer_reviews.title: One of my best purchases to date
customer_reviews.text: One of my best purchases to date. My only wish is that the cable were longer and less flimsy looking, something similar to the M50x would be amazing. But it cancels out a lot of the ambient noise, and the bright blue light deters passerbys from engaging in conversation :). Only mode 1 is effective, and the rest two remain unused since I do not usually work in a cafe or in a quiet place.
customer_reviews.author: Akshay Chandrashekaran

customer_reviews.title: Easily comparable to the Boise QuietComfort 25
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, item was as described!! My girlfriend used them on her trip to Ireland and loved both the comfort of the headphones on the 8 hour plane ride and the Active Noise Cancelling (Airplane) mode feature. Her last set of headphones were only comfortable for a couple of hours but she was able to wear the Audio Technica ATH-ANC9 for the full 8 hours without any discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Raved For Weeks
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my son's birthday. He raved about them for weeks. Still does. Says it is the best he received! Well worth the price and, the service was great!
customer_reviews.author: Doce

customer_reviews.title: needs visual power indicator
customer_reviews.text: they work fine for me, but with a human factors qualification. see, i take headsets off and on, alot, then at least once a week forget to power 'em off at the end of the day. so of course the battery drains. the unit really needs an l.e.d. imo.
customer_reviews.author: Cupertino Jay

customer_reviews.title: Sounds better "on" but not as nice as the ATH-M50 set
customer_reviews.text: Slightly tight on the head. Seals well. Sounds better "on" but not as nice as the ATH-M50 set. They do seem to sound better than the Bose QC25 but the noise cancelling seems slightly less "good". They are also tighter feeling than the lighter Bose.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Verbeek

customer_reviews.title: Great Noise Cancelling Headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones really are great. I got an opportunity to try my friend's Bose Noise Cancelling headphones and I was super impressed. I also had the opportunity to try the Bose ones at my local Best Buy. I can honestly say that these headphones cancel sound just as well, if not better than the Bose. I have always been a fan of Audio Technica products and these did not disappoint. I have had no fatigue when wearing them and their sound is great, even without any batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product!
customer_reviews.text: Love this item! Excellent quality,super comfortable, I wore for hours in a row on long flight. Couldn’t be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Klein

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I am loving these headphones! Perfect for my plane rides! I no longer need ear plugs on the plane. Just put these on and turn on the switch and the cancellation is just amazing. Allows me to watch movies and listen to music as a reasonable volume too. I do have to take them off to have conversations. The sound bleed would be an issue in a quieter environment though. It's pretty loud outside the headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Sequoiadrvr

customer_reviews.title: Great studying headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great noise cancelling headphones for half that of Bose. Did my research and these are great for studying. However rough travel like on a bus will disconnect that feature due to a lose battery case
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Get the best for less
customer_reviews.text: This is a very high quality product. I fly a lot and have tried most of the products out there. For one half the cost you get a better product than the Bose overpriced headphones. It may not have the status of Bose but you will be happy with these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: NV Fisherman

customer_reviews.title: Great at quieting surrounding noise.
customer_reviews.text: Great for traveling. I purchased for my fiance traveling internationally. He said they worked really well keeping exterior sounds at a minimum. He told me I had to buy my own. lol
customer_reviews.author: S. Joscelyn

customer_reviews.title: They travel well and sound great!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using them for years. They are great audio quality, comfortable, and compact/light. The case is also a nice touch. One thing to note (the reason for a 4 and not a 5 star rating): The ear pads tend to fall apart after about a year, but can be replaced for cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon A Wehn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headphones! I used these on my trip from ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent headphones! I used these on my trip from L.A. to Bangkok, Thailand and they worked great! I would not travel or go to a hotel without them. I can crank the music as loud as I can handle (max) and not disturb anyone, not even if they are sitting next to me. The sound is quality great. And I am picky about sound quality. And I can wear them comfortably for long periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Phillips

customer_reviews.title: excellent hearing aid
customer_reviews.text: I had the product's expectation in relation to its price, upon receiving it it exceeded my expectations, great sound, very good isolation of exterior sound, I am still testing the duration of the alkaline battery
customer_reviews.author: Germán

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones, great price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, it has exceeded my expectations especially when using it without noise canceling on. That are very comfortable, and the case is also great. The only thing that would be nice is for a volume control unit inline on the cable, but since the cables are compatible with any replacement, this can be solved easily if needed. I would recomend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Dean

customer_reviews.title: Great till they fell apart
customer_reviews.text: Used for a little over 1 year when I travel. Probably 100-150 hours of use. In the course of a week in which they saw light use, both earpads just exploded and have rendered them effectively useless. Replacements don't appear to be available through amazon and AT, and off brand ones were tried and were unsurprisingly terrible. A shame too because otherwise, I loved them.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Betournay

customer_reviews.title: Will the ear pads last?
customer_reviews.text: They seem to perform as expected, I'm wearing them around the house to see how the ear pads last. That has been the biggest negative in the reviews. Time will tell, so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: mnbigjohn

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I use these headphones for video editing and monitoring sound recording at my video shoots. Noise cancellation really helps isolate me from noisy concert environment. Love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Andriy Samusenko

customer_reviews.title: Great for the right application.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent noice cancelling for steady mechanical noise like an AC unit. Not great for sudden noise like talking or phones ringing. 5 stars because the quality and function of these while playing music is incredible. Just didn't work for me at the office so I returned them. I would repurchase in a second if I had to fly or travel by bus/train a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Baynham

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Love the fact that the audio stays on even with dead batteries, can't say the same for BOSE QC2's. Also there are three different levels of Noise cancelling that you can select, again, cant say that for BOSE. Took them on a 16 hr flight and they were very comfortable. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Audio quality is very good. They aren't the most comfortable to wear for ...
customer_reviews.text: Audio quality is very good. They aren't the most comfortable to wear for extended periods of time but they do an excellent job of reducing airplane noise for long flights. Noise bleedthrough isn't bad at all and would be almost imperceptible over plane drone on all but the loudest of audio volumes.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I read a LOT of reviews before settling on these headphones. I detest flying on commercial flights and had to fly across the country and back recently. I WILL NEVER FLY WITHOUT MY AUDIO TECHNICA QUIETPOINT NOISE CANCELLING HEADPHONES!!! I put on my sunglasses, put on my headphones, hit the switch on the left earpiece, and was transported to a quiet oasis of music and isolation for the entire 5 1/2 hour flight. I was able to hear the quietest passages of music easily, despite being seated in the very noisy tail of the plane. These headphones are awesome, and I'm so glad there are viable alternatives to BOSE'S overpriced products.
customer_reviews.author: rubiconartist

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t fly without it
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I couldn’t fly without it. But remember this model is not cordless.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves them
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband. He loves them he uses them for travel and leisure. They seem good quality and are good for the prices. They are wired so no bluetooth capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: Jo-anne K.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for a while and they have met my needs. They're comfortable, have good sound quality and reduce background noise. These are the first noise cancelling headphones I have used so I can't compare them to others. I think they're a fair value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: TM

customer_reviews.title: The noise cancelling was pretty good, but it's really only intended for low ...
customer_reviews.text: The noise cancelling was pretty good, but it's really only intended for low frequencies, like airplanes or buses. The sound quality is disappointing though, the sound is very clear, but not full at all. I compared them to a pair of Beats headphones I have (which as far as headphones go, aren't the best in sound quality) and the Audio Tech headphones sounded weak and thin in sound quality by comparison. Maybe some people value clearness of sound (like headphones that keep the music from sounding a bit muddy), but I value fullness of sound, so these headphones weren't for me.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and comfort
customer_reviews.text: My best headphones so far. I'm really pleased with the quality of the sound and the comfort (I can wear it a full day at work). The noise-reducing function deforms the sound though, but it doesn't bother me, I still like it. The only negative point is that the pad started to come off early, which is really disappointing for that price. I read that we can change them but didn't do it yet.
customer_reviews.author: MA

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Great for planes. In my opinion, blocks out about the same amount of noise and sounds about the same in terms of sound quality as the Bose competitors. These have a much better price though.
customer_reviews.author: Collin

customer_reviews.title: Good protection for my hearing
customer_reviews.text: Elegant, comfortable, simple, good battery life, nice case, Flight to Europe was very restful and when I did watch some movies I could actually hear them Due to the noise cancelling feature, you can hear the soundtrack even when the volume is not that loud. I think they'll protect my hearing for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Bob of Westerville

customer_reviews.title: I've been using these daily at my desk at work ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these daily at my desk at work. No heavy use, travel or abuse; they were never dropped or smashed. I don't play loud music, not that that should matter. They broke after 6 months. The left speaker stopped working. I've tried it against different cables and machines and nothing. I spent $300 on these things and they're broken.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Zuchlewski

product_meta.title: Audio-Technica ATH-ANC9 QuietPoint Active Noise-Cancelling Headphones
product_meta.description: Product Packaging:Standard PackagingAudio-Technica's ATH-ANC9 QuietPoint headphones use proprietary active noise-cancelling technology to provide a comfortable listening environment in areas with high ambient noise. Delivering noise cancellation up to a remarkable 95%, the ATH-ANC9 QuietPoint headphones feature Audio-Technica's new Tri-Level Cancellation. Mode 1, ideal for use on airplanes, trains and buses, applies maximum noise cancellation to low frequencies. Mode 2, designed especially for use in noisy offices or crowded places, targets the mid-range frequencies, while Mode 3 creates a pristine, peaceful environment ideal for study. The headphones feature four miniature microphones, two in each earpiece, that pick up ambient noise and create a sound-cancelling signal to effectively block the noise. The ATH-ANC9 headphones also offer a cable with an inline microphone and controller for answering calls and controlling music. The mic and controller support select products, including iPhones, iPads, and many iPods. The microphone has an omnidirectional pickup pattern and it is designed for crisp intelligibility, so your voice will be clearly transmitted without having to speak directly into the mic. These headphones are designed to offer you crystal-clear sound that makes Audio-Technica the choice of leading artists worldwide. Wherever you happen to find yourself-in the comfort of your living room, in a noisy office, or settling in for a long flight-there is no better way to experience audio or immerse yourself in a peaceful environment.
feature_bullets: Frequency Response - 10 – 40,000 Hz and Impedance - 16 ohms
